lead_paragraph: The Obama administration will broaden the effort to allow families of children fleeing dangerous conditions to enter the United States with them.

byline.contributor: Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.

headline.print_headline: Central America Child Refugee Program Is Expanded to Include Entire Families
headline.main: U.S. to Admit More Central American Refugees

snippet: The Obama administration will broaden the effort to allow families of children fleeing dangerous conditions to enter the United States with them....
abstract: Obama administration announces significant expansion of program that currently allows Central American children to enter the United States as refugees, and allows their families, including caregivers and siblings over 21, refugee status as well; Republicans denounce expansion, saying it is another example of Pres Obama abusing his authority.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
